website_summaries.verdict: This jackhammer isn't built for demolition speed, but it will handle up to 5 inch deep concrete pads with ease. We recommend wearing heavy gloves and eye protection while operating this "old school" concrete breaker.
pros: Point and blade bits are hardened steel, not generic quality
Works on many types of construction materials
Popular choice for homeowners with small to medium demo needs
cons: Older design means increased chipping and vibrations
Stands low to the ground, some back bending needed
Oil leakage is a common concern

customer_reviews.title: Short term life span no warranty
customer_reviews.text: The product was easy to handle and it did work well for a couple of months. Then it quit. It overheated and stopped working. I purchaseded a 4 year warranty and neither the warranty company (SquaredTrade) , ExtremepowerUS, nor Amazon would accept the warranty claim. They all kept saying it was the other persons responsibility. That’s the problem with these circumstances. It is offered by “amazon” sold by “ihubdeal” and warranted by “SquareTrade” and they all want to point fingers when its time for a claim
customer_reviews.author: prgrssv

customer_reviews.title: Equipment malfunction
customer_reviews.text: I have bought this equipment and I hardly use it and one day I decided to use it for ten minutes and afterwards i started to see smoke coming rom the equipment and it also started to overhead and then it just stop working.I have contacted cust service about the issue and ask for a refund but no such luck with the A-Z refund policy and they turn it down my request .So how would i encourage someone to buy this equipment if you can't get no compensation for something that you didnt do anything wrong.After sale Service is poor.
customer_reviews.author: kevin

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: I am a general contractor who was skeptical about buying this jack hammer because of the price. Let me tell you it's amazing, it's just as good as the ones for $1500. I took out 250 square feet of 6 inch thick sidewalk in just a couple hours with this unit with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's a POS! Stay away!
customer_reviews.text: I thought like so many here that I bought a value priced unit that should last me some time for many projects. I used it sparingly to break up a step, removing some concrete that was holding posts and a small 3" concrete pad. It was on the concrete pad where this unit actually broke in half! Yes, it broke in half. The metal casing just fell apart, the oil came out out and the hammer mechanism fell out. I couldn't believe it. Will just save my money for a Bosch or Hitachi demo hammer. I thought I was saving money, but it turned out I wasted money. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: 24/7 woodworker

customer_reviews.title: it's just OK
customer_reviews.text: I bough it to bust through 4 inches of concrete in the basement so I can install plumbing for a new bathroom. It's a pretty decent tool for the price and the size, but mine started leaking oil after a couple of hours of use. I'll hold on to it for now - hopefully i'll figure out a way to fix it.
customer_reviews.author: FCVP

customer_reviews.title: Another use it and throw it away tool.
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. It breaks up concrete just fine. This is basically another one time use tool. This is not built for years, or even months of regular use. Mine is puking oil all down the bit after only 20' of sidewalk demo. Have not been able to find any replacement parts for this, other than bits, motor brushes, and handles. Have searched online for hours and nothing. Its cheaper than renting a demo hammer if your old and slow like me. Which is the only good thing about this tool. Use it till it dies, and scrap it out.
customer_reviews.author: SKOOTERBUM

customer_reviews.title: Mine is just one of many that LEAKS OIL BAD!!
customer_reviews.text: This brand new jackhammer leaks oil like crazy. Many other reviews on other sites mentioned this too. I am using it to pound rebar into logs for our log home. On the third bar, it started spraying all over the logs. I worked hard to get them peeled, power washed, brushed & sanded; now this. One Amazon person with same problem said he was going to see if using 90W gear oil instead of thin oil, never heard back. I'll have to try it - but why sell junk like this???
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Lousy warranty
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item and it worked well the first time I used it. Two months later I used it again and the handle broke off. The two-star rating is for customer service and warranty. I would probably give it a four-star for the product itself, if the handle didn't break. I got in touch with Amazon and they told me to contact XtremepowerUS, which I did. XtremepowerUS told me that they only honor Amazon's one month warranty! But they would gladly sell me a new handle for $30. I wound up jury rigging the handle.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight Use at Best, Leaks Oil
customer_reviews.text: There's nothing 'heavy duty' about this jack hammer. It was a waste of money for me. It leaked oil everywhere after only 2-3 uses. I would only break up the softest /thinnest of rock on my lot. Unless you just need something for breaking up the lightest of material, don't buy this one. Just threw it in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff T.

customer_reviews.title: Leaking oil
customer_reviews.text: This unit started leaking oil after 10 hours of use. Attempted to get repair parts but xtremepowerusa doesn't seem to be set up to provide repair parts or fix busted units. It worked great for 10 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Value
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to remove fence posts that had been concreted in. There were a dozen or so, and it did the job. The rental place wanted $100 for the day for a name brand, so I figured I'd be way ahead if it worked. It did, and I was. The next task was considerably more difficult, going down 2 feet in solid rock, actually lava (Hawaii). It slowly pulverized the lava, and eventually did what I wanted. One of the bits broke off about 30 minutes into the job, but the other survived to finish. It gets a 4 because the bit broke and the instructions are terrible, but I'd buy this again in a second.
customer_reviews.author: Lou

customer_reviews.title: Good power but oil everywhere
customer_reviews.text: Not bad for the price, but oil everywhere. I decided to return it. Thanks Amazon for its return policy.
customer_reviews.author: henry

customer_reviews.title: Oil leak, may be a used product but I ordered  a new one paid for new one
customer_reviews.text: Oil leaked everywhere inside the package..Also there are paint chipping marks on the tool. Not sure if it was returned and repacked... did not turn on yet because there is no oil.
customer_reviews.author: Melkyarputharaja

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed that it says 1 1/8 hex but doesn't except standard 1 1/8 hex bits . I purchased it for a specific job removing glue down wood flooring and at the same time bought the attachment for that task which was a standard bit , but it will not fit this machine, does fit my Bigger Bosch but I was hoping for a lighter tool that would wear the user out . The bits that come with it must be standard in Europe or China but you probably will not be able to find any here at least I haven't had any luck.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Leaking Oil
customer_reviews.text: I bought it 11 month ago and used it about 5 times and it started leaking oil down the chisel. Amazon refers to the manufacturer who did not responded to multiple emails. Also nobody offers Spare Parts and again:"xtremepowerusa.com" does not even responses. Stay away from this tool.
customer_reviews.author: EmmaReadsAlot

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite toy
customer_reviews.text: I am a female do-it-your-selfer, never even touched a jackhammer before, so no comparison. It arrived today, I spent hours (by myself) breaking up an old sidewalk and concrete slab. Then I transplanted several plants with ease! (shovel attachment-best thing ever). All I had to do was balance it, (easy, not too heavy) pull the trigger and go. It does leak oil, I think it's meant to reduce friction during use? It arrived with oil all over in the case, which I expected after reading other reviews. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Meesh

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: The first one I ordered had a broken handle, but amazon was quick to replace it. I was able to remove 450 sq ft of tile in a commercial bathroom in about 20 minutes. If I never use it again, this was money well spent!!
customer_reviews.author: Second Nature Customs

customer_reviews.title: Add oil before using
customer_reviews.text: The product is great. I had some concerns about using a 46 pound power tool, as I am 5'3" and weigh 126 pounds. But after a brief learning curve, I found a productive groove and got a lot done. Thanks to all of the reviewers that posted tips and answered questions! Without this input, I probably would have returned the product. The instruction manual provided was a bit of a bad joke. I found it had little or no value. That's why I dinged the overall review by 1 star. This beast has become my favorite power tool. My friends are lining up to borrow it.
customer_reviews.author: David Orphey

customer_reviews.title: It's worked on everything
customer_reviews.text: I've has this hammer for a couple of years and it hasn't let me down once. I've tore up driveways, knocked out fence posts and even used it to drive well pipe down 45 feet. The only thing that gave me trouble is the box it came in. The 3 locking tabs fall off very easy. After losing one forever, I double check the latches every time and keep the box in one spot. If anybody knows where to get replacement latches, please let me know.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Bill

customer_reviews.title: Works great until it doesnt. blew oil gasket within a couple months of purchase. LEAKS OIL!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this from amazon on March 17, 2020. It worked great to break up a concrete walkway up to my house that is 3 feet wide and about 80 feet long. I was initially very pleased with this product, but by the end of the job i noticed it had started leaking oil out of the main shaft. After further investigation and light use it leaks oil profusely and seems unsafe to use. I must have blown a seal or gasket. Very disappointing for something only a few months old.
customer_reviews.author: kodiakkodiak

customer_reviews.title: Does the job at a good price point
customer_reviews.text: This tool is HEAVY, especially when compared to the top brands. You get the most LB/Dollar..... Aside from that, it is solid built and does the job. The cost would be what you would pay for renting s tool for 2 days, so if you have a project it is worth the money, and then some. Already used it on multiple projects, excavation, large planting project (50+ bushes and large plants), a cable line and a water line. Note that the oil bleeds when you use the tool, so it gets messy and you need to clean it up after use, and make sure the oil levels are good before next use.
customer_reviews.author: Adim

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, add oil each use
customer_reviews.text: Worked. But was covered in oil and have to add oil for each use. Very cheap and does its job, but add oil!
customer_reviews.author: Rich C

customer_reviews.title: Bought this rather then renting one
customer_reviews.text: We are busting up an 8' by 9' pad that is 9" to 15" thick. Last Saturday we did about 2/3 of the pad. Tomorrow we will finish it up. We used this for about 5 hours continuously. It gets hot but keeps right on running. I would recommend this for the occasional use. If your a Pro this obviously would not be sufficient. Make sure to put some oil it it before you start to use it. As you can see from the photo it is light enough for my daughter to use.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald D. Zuber II

customer_reviews.title: Oil leak
customer_reviews.text: Received it and it had an oil leak coming from where the bit is inserted. I called the rep and she said no oil should be present in that area. Never even got a chance to use it and send it back.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Died after 3 months of use
customer_reviews.text: I've been using it on and off for weekend projects at home over the last 3 months. Nothing overly It just died on me. Checked the power source and the power is getting to the motor. Seems like something internal. I don't see any type of warranty so I'm assuming it's stuck on the Amazon 30 day warranty... This stinks.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Merlino

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this is a great tool. Harbor Freight really can't match this given their similar priced tool is smaller and by the time you purchase the chisels it costs more. The 2 issues with this are incomplete instruction manual and oil spec. It does not show to flip the spring latch over to contain the chisel in the drive slot. It also does not come with oil, nor specify the correct oil. A quick internet search provides decent videos on use. Then, like any oil discussion, opinions vary. 40 weight Rotella seems to be the best choice specified. For the price of the tool I will take a chance on using 10W-30 that I have on hand.
customer_reviews.author: 50 in the Fort

customer_reviews.title: Powerful
customer_reviews.text: It's heavy and powerful! This cannot be light for obvious reasons. So that's not a negative comment but just letting the buyers know the reality of what you are getting. I consider myself pretty strong, but this takes a toll. Found new respect for the construction workers who have to use this stuff all the time! I had to do some work in my basement, and this made the job whole lot easier... but my body suffered a bit the next two days. If you have a DIY project, then this is a great machine to own. If you don't have to do it yourself, then hire a contractor instead. ;)
customer_reviews.author: shinkimchi

customer_reviews.title: nice tool
customer_reviews.text: Ok - these guys were great about me returning my 1st Demolition Hammer as it wasn't "hammering". I got the 2nd one within a few days and it has been banging out concrete and the hardest soil ever since without nary a problem! its heavy but my 14 yo son was able to go for an hour without taking a break and the bits this machine came with are solid and sharp! strong work on making this baby! REading many reviews I see that guys who use these things daily are perfectly happy with it over the $1200.00 name brand Jacks so for my purposes it will likely last.... foreverrrrrr....foreeeeevvvvverrrrrr.... thanks again guys!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: WOW is all I can say...
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love it. Plenty of power for the price. Used it for about an hour nonstop. Even my daughter joined in the fun lol. I was honestly expecting something with less power for the price I paid but after reading all the reviews I decided to give it a go. Within an hour we had most of the flower bed demoed. All problem I see at the moment is the latches on the case fall off when the case it opened but im not complaining. Harbor Freight wanted $349 (i believe it was) for basically the same unit.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Well made, but it is heavy, especially once ...
customer_reviews.text: Well made, but it is heavy, especially once you add the "shovel" attachment. I'm 66 and this can be a bit to handle. It seems to be able to cut/dig through just about anything. The 12/2 extension cord adds a bit to the final price ($89 at HD for 100 feet). I did try the lighter weight cords (14-2), but for continuous operating, it would trip a 15 amp circuit.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny L

customer_reviews.title: Amazing, I saved thousands with this tool
customer_reviews.text: So I wanted to dig out my basement but I knew by hands was impossible, I went to a tool rental they told me it would coat me $370 a week or 85 a day , Since I was digging just me and 2 other guys that would be thousands of dollar , But you know amazon got everything, I wanted to see how much it cost , when I saw the price I was like “this gotta be trash” ...believe it or not I bought another 2 weeks later because I couldn’t believe How fast I was digging the basement with this tool ... this is basically a free ride that you was looking for any DIY
customer_reviews.author: Gilson Pires

customer_reviews.title: Absolute beast. Perfect for a difficult job. Taken off about 2 tons of tile so far.
customer_reviews.text: What a workhorse! One of the hardest remodel jobs I've done to date has been to remove Saltillo tile from our living room and foyer (~750 sq ft). Underneath the tile, backer board, and thinset I found original hardwood floors that I aim to refinish and preserve. First attempt was with an air chisel...to no effect. Then I priced out renting a demo hammer at HD and decided to give this guy a shot since I would be working on this job only about 4 hrs / day. Did the trick...on a tricky job of removing all the backer & tile without damaging wood floors underneath. Very, very impressed with this relatively inexpensive tool! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Moody123

customer_reviews.title: Aggravations Galore
customer_reviews.text: The two bits broke with less than 4 minutes of use. I asked for replacements and TWICE I received hammer drill bits even though the picture shows jackhammer bits. If you want aggravating hassles: this is the vendor for you
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly good value
customer_reviews.text: Very quick delivery and nicely packed. Only briefly tested the unit to make sure it worked, but initial observations are that it seems to be a robust, well-made, quality item with everything that you could want in a convenient, blow-molded case that has suitcase-like wheels for easy transport. During the very brief test it seemed to perform well and the spade attachment made easy work of hard soil that would normally require a pickaxe (should have bought one of these years ago). Fortunately it is obvious how to use the unit as the instructions are not very well written. Assuming that nothing goes wrong, it is amazingly good value for money!
customer_reviews.author: Chris R

customer_reviews.title: Went through rock and hard clay with ease.  :)
customer_reviews.text: The jackhammer worked great! I bought it to bust through sandstone in a trench I'm digging, but I ordered a but late for that. (My fault. ) Instead, I used it to break up buried gravel mixed with hard clay. I couldn't even get the shovel in the ground. The jackhammer went through it with ease. Much better than using a pick axe. I'll update this review after I run into sandstone with my next trench. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: R. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Powerful uses 20-40 motor oil
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly in heavy duty box. As indicated, it ships without added or included (no surprise). What is surprising is that the manufacter and seller do not identify the correct oil. I received a quick response to my email from xtremepiwerusa and they said to use "20-40 weight motor oil". More than a few reviews mentioned oil leaks. I noticed a slight film of oil on the toolbit after removing it. Not enough to run down the bit. Plenty of power for occasional home use.Hope it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Packs a punch!
customer_reviews.text: The little Jack Hammer that could! I mainly use this thing for tile removal (on concrete), breaking up small slabs of sidewalk (4-6" thick) and breaking larger rocks into smaller ones to move. It's nice and light weight. Heavy enough to get the job done, but not so heavy that it breaks your back. I would not call this thing heavy duty, but for small jobs it is perfect. I removed approx 1200 sq ft of travertine tile in about 2 hrs (with a few 5 min breaks).
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Works great for the some jobs
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately the slab I was trying to demo was 10" thick way beyond this jackhammers capability, it took 10 minutes just to break off a little piece of concrete. I ended up renting a Makita 70# jackhammer & it chewed the concrete up. Did use this one to help split the cracks when the Makita got stuck. I bought the compactor attachment, works great also the shovel. I'd definitely buy it again would work great for 4" concrete. Can't go wrong for the price
customer_reviews.author: loosewill

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed, worth every penney
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for tile removal. Price is cheaper than a rental would have been and now I own it. This thing has some serious power and is seriously heavy duty. I opted for the version with the tile chisel and it is still sharp after 1000 sq ft of tile removal. Found the recommended oil at Wal-Mart for about 5 bucks. Don't count on the included safety equipment though. Invest in some better quality gloves, safety glasses and breather mask for tile removal.
customer_reviews.author: ajonesaz

customer_reviews.title: It does the job
customer_reviews.text: Tried get people break up 13 X 19 foot patio would not come so as you know if want something done properly do it your self . Tried different product they were no good broke after 4 hours use. Been using then 5 hours each day put in back of my pickup on top of the UN loader so get land fill just turn handle UN load all concrete what you see is 5 hours work breaking it up by my self. You can not go wrong with this breaking up concrete
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Out works me so far...
customer_reviews.text: Used it heavy the last 2 days to break stone off an exterior wall. Video is my helper on the scaffolding. Stone and mortar are 4” thick. It has no problem breaking it. I’m used to a 14 lb hammer drill so this is definitely a workout. A lighter version would be smarter on walls, but it gets it done quick. By 2017 it would be nice to have instructions written using proper english grammar, but it’s not too tough to piece together. I’m having trouble finding the right bits for it. I know they’re common, but I still can find the name for them in the description!!! Cmon!!!
customer_reviews.author: AmAddiktedToThisPlace

customer_reviews.title: A huge bargain
customer_reviews.text: For the price, it can't really be beat. The extra accessories I bought costed more than the main machine (shovel bit and the 10W extension cord), lol. I only use it to dig holes into the clay soil for planting trees. It does not tax the machine much at all. For my use, it cuts thru soil like it's tofu. I will someday use it to bust up my concrete drive way and maybe other stuff. Will update review if I do. For now, I can't be more pleased. One of the biggest bargin I got this year so far.
customer_reviews.author: ryliu_us

customer_reviews.title: it was a good investment. Even if it dies
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to tear out a retaining wall foundation and layer of brick 3/4 buried in dirt. Tried the old fashioned way with sledge hammer and pry bar. Back breaking work. So I took a shot on this. The result was a complete job (about 40 ft of wall) in an hour. The weight is considerable but not unmanageable. You really don't have to apply force or bear down extremely hard, I just let the tool work. For the price, it was a good investment. Even if it dies, it has already paid for itself vs renting a tool. Very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Dibble

customer_reviews.title: Same price as a 1 day rental! Don't rent buy!
customer_reviews.text: ***** (BUY IT) I knew I had over a days’ worth of hammering. This was cheaper to buy then rent and if it stopped working, send it back. I got this back in summer of 2018. The photos are from my 1st project with the hammer and it worked great! I have now completed 3 concrete projects and the hammer is still working like new! Don't get me wrong it’s not as heavy duty as a $800 Bosch and defiantly not as nice to use. (i.e. hard on your hands back etc. What hammer is not?) But for the MONEY (cheap) it GETS the job DONE! BUY IT don't rent one!
customer_reviews.author: M_White008

customer_reviews.title: Don’t be fooled by the price, this thing packs a punch!
customer_reviews.text: I had two small concrete patches I needed to get rid of in my backyard, I went back and forth about renting out a jackhammer from my local hardware store. After seeing this price and rental prices I thought, eh what do I have to lose? Well, turns out I lost absolutely nothing and ended up with probably one of my best amazon purchases to this day. This thing is a little beast! I was able to get both of my jobs done in less than an hour! I was super impressed with the quality and easy instructions! This is ABSOLUTELY my new favorite tool!
customer_reviews.author: Ali Y.

customer_reviews.title: This hammer kicks some butt!
customer_reviews.text: - I needed jack hammer for a small job in my yard. I thought of renting, but chose to purchase this instead. I was impressed with what I received. The hammer came in a plastic case w/wheels, not super heavy duty but nice. It also had a pair of goggles, a respirator and pair of work gloves. It very easy to add oil to the reservoir. The cord is a substantial length. The main point is that this thing really works well, and cut through concrete and slump block with ease. It's not overly heavy and is easy to hold while working. I think this may be the best $169.00 I have ever spent.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Worth its weight in gold
customer_reviews.text: Wow. Cant believe this thing is so cheap. It costs almost the same to rent one of these than it is to buy one. This thing is a monster. I have redone my bathroom which required me to move drains for my tub and shower. I have broken up 8 inches of concrete ( 4 inches at a time ) without no issues. I love this thing. Powerful and it brings its own case on wheels with two tips. What more can you ask for? I saved my self $1000 and removed my bathroom tiles my self. Just do it.
customer_reviews.author: partyoffive

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value! Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I'm very impressed with this super inexpensive jack hammer! I used to rent at the tone of 85 bucks a day. This thing has already saved me money, came full of oil, and hasn't lost a drop as of now. About 10 hours of actual use on the machine so far. It has done a great job of busting up old mortar beds and concrete (about 6 inches thick) as of now I am pleased with the purchase and recommend it! The case sucks though. So just be careful with it. And the PPE included are throw away items. But I didn't buy the thing for the safety gear and box. This jack hammer has been great!
customer_reviews.author: David Briot

customer_reviews.title: I don't know if this particular one was defective but ...
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if this particular one was defective but after every 2/3 minutes it would stop working on his own so i will definitely send it back i wish i would be able to exchange it but i don't know if that's posible I'm remodeling my two bathrooms and i need to move the toilet from locations about 2 feet away so i still need one that would get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: S. Elmasri

customer_reviews.title: Works really well.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to break apart some hard ledge. Lasted about 24 hours of straight use. While the impact per minute is less then a $1K Makita, I was impressed by its power. Only complaint is that the screws eventually start falling out of the unit and it leaks some oil. My recommendation is that you buy some Loc-Tite and apply to the screws at the bottom of the unit prior to use. Case comes with this unit and two bits, a spare set of brushes, laughable safety glasses and dust mask.
customer_reviews.author: Techkie

customer_reviews.title: Pneumatic shovel is the way !!
customer_reviews.text: This jackhammer is awesome. Bought for myself as we live where the land is rock hard and I want to plant trees. The landscape company we hired didn't have one and borrowed mine. The owner asked me to get one for him. Yes, it IS heavy but does a fantastic job. If you need a shovel for a big job and you want to make the job much easier get one of these. They have dug about 400 feet of trench about 18 inches deep, no problem. What a fantastic piece of equipment. You WILL be pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Hall

customer_reviews.title: You're Not Going to Believe It
customer_reviews.text: Excellent bang for the buck. Suggest you get the wider chisel blade for concrete breakout. Does a great job and doesn't break the bank. I'm really surprised at this unit's ability to easily break up large amounts (overkill) of concrete around 4X4 fenceposts that used to take hours with with demolition pick and 12# sledge. Get one of these and work smarter and not harder. I wish I'd have gotten one of these years ago.
customer_reviews.author: John Boy

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: I am a female and I find it's difficult to move the item because it's quite heavy but I purchased it together with a friend so with the 2 of us we can manage quite well. Once it's in the upright position it's really not that bad and I can operate it by myself. I bought it primarily to dig holes to plant trees and bushes and to dig out tree stumps. It works well for my purposes. I would recommend it if using it for the same purposes as myself.
customer_reviews.author: Janny

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but sloppy craftsmanship.
customer_reviews.text: I had a problem with the grip not fitting correctly right out of the box. I was able to fix that but the handle that is about halfway down the tool is already broken and spins freely, even after tightening it to the maximum amount: it has tore up the paint around the handle. Aside from that the machine works really well and I definitely would recommend this to any of my friends. I was using it for breaking up very rocky dirt to put in my electrical line and found that using just the spike bit and prying back a little works better than a spade bit, for anyone wondering. I believe we used 5w-40 oil in it.
customer_reviews.author: ken

customer_reviews.title: Its a pretty good tool, but
customer_reviews.text: Its a pretty good tool, but why four stars?: 1. After about 20 minutes of hard pounding this thing gets very hot. Hot enough to make you to put it down and do something else for a bit. 2. It came with the incorrect amount of oil in it. Be sure to check this first. 3. The upper grab handle does not really secure that well to the tool. Kinda annoying when it moves while your pounding away. However, this is a pretty good tool, and works as advertised. ps: You can spend many hundreds and get a tool inferior to this.
customer_reviews.author: Leala

customer_reviews.title: BULL DOG!
customer_reviews.text: 5 stars from this retired contractor. Be careful because you may wedge this in and then you SOL! LMAO, I did get it stuck and it was a beast to separate. I'm smart enough to get the 3 main tools, Point, chisel, shovel as part of the package price. WAY cheaper to buy then rent. I was thinking of selling this after my sewer line repair to the basement floor... Nah ill keep it! POWER! A must have is ear muffs, ear protection, water to control the dust, Oil for the reservoir to lube MUST BE WATCHED!
customer_reviews.author: nj.firefighter

customer_reviews.title: Be careful with it... It can bite, and it's not very well-made.
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty good at digging holes in hard dirt. I haven't tried it on any hard concrete yet, but I don't have a tremendous amount of confidence in it. A few components are pretty cheesy. I'll use it for my own projects, because I can be careful with it, but I would not give it to a bunch of unsupervised knuckleheads (unskilled, uncaring workers), or a neighbor who doesn't treat other people's tools well.
customer_reviews.author: Brian V.

customer_reviews.title: Good entry level jack hammer. Unit needs to be a little longer with a longer cord.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one of these. Great for sending ground rods straight to china. ** People who want this for driving ground rods. With and without the ground rod attachment it works well. If you do want the attachment, the TR Ground Rod Driver amazon sells works perfectly with the chuck of this thing. It's probably the same manufacturer somewhere down the line. I did not have to modify anything. It slides right in and locks. Remember to add oil. (plain old 15w40 I've been using for two seasons without issue.)
customer_reviews.author: Phelps

customer_reviews.title: Econo King
customer_reviews.text: Its heavy, and the case is very low quality, but in terms of high end DIY projects (basement floor replacement) its cost/production rate is unbeatable. Mine leaked all its oil out by the time I got it so I had to add a bunch, but so far (~50sf into the project) it has preformed awesome. My concrete removal (break & pile) rate with 4"-6" of varying quality concrete (1925 to 2017) is roughly 12sf per hour, working completely alone.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Works Fine
customer_reviews.text: Many of the problems other reviewers have seem to be more a lack of understanding how to use this item. It is heavy with a strong stroke. I am not as young as I use to be, but I am 6'2" and 200lbs, and it is WORK to use this thing. Does a good job and I have been using it on granite boulders. Lean in with too little pressure and it works poorly. Lean in too hard, ditto. Judge your weight to get a good, strong stroke and she eats granite.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money spent!
customer_reviews.text: Finally got to use this digging up some old fence posts encased in concrete. It worked great! Just be sure to keep the oil level up and visible in the center of the sight glass. Came with the chisel tip and the shovel tip. I ordered the chisel point tip to go with it. A comparable name brand jackhammer would probably run about $700-$850 dollars, so this is a great value and seems to be very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Flyin' Hawaiian

customer_reviews.title: Lots of power for the price
customer_reviews.text: For the cost of this you can't go wrong. I decided to purchase a jackhammer because it wasn't much more than the cost of a rental not to mention having to pick up and drop off the rental. Used this to break up over a thousand square feet of 8 inch thick concrete and it busted it up with no problem. Since I've purchased it I have rented it out to a few people at half the cost of what rental companies charge so it's already paid for itself and has made me some money and everyone who has used it is surprised with how well it works.
customer_reviews.author: allan butler

customer_reviews.title: Nice Jack Hammer!
customer_reviews.text: I called a local rental company and they wanted $100.00 per day to rent a jack hammer. Found this on one for $139.00 and thought give it a chance. It worked beyond my expectation! I took out a 10 X 24 wire mesh reinforced concrete pad in less then a day. The concrete pad was 4" in the middle and 6" on the outside. This jack hammer had no problem breaking up the concrete. I would highly recommend this if you are considering a demolition hammer..
customer_reviews.author: Michael Gill

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this when I worked at Rebath and they wanted us to do the hammering for the plumbers but all we had were SDS drills. Figured this would save my back, thought I could toss it after my last few months working there. It kept kicking just fine. At my new company, they ran it for 3 days using it to scrape up tile, then brought it to my job and started knocking this out. Blowing right threw it. Not the power of a DeWalt or Bosch, but for the average remodeler or someone needing a backup it's wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: thePost

customer_reviews.title: This is the second one I've bought in the last ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I've bought in the last two years. I own a construction company and we use these almost everyday. The first one we had to replace the electrical cord after about three months of constant abuse. That one finally didn't perform as well after about a year probably because it just needed new brushes but we just bought another one since they were so cheap. I sure got more than my money's worth.
customer_reviews.author: Darrel Agpawa

customer_reviews.title: bit installation instructions poor
customer_reviews.text: Instructions are terrible. Messed with bit installation for an hour b4 realizing its simple. There are "heads on both sides of the locking shaft. You can pull out the one with a cotter pin and rotate it, bit does nothing. Pull out the head on the other side (has two flat sides) and voila! Easy peasy. Haven't usex this yet but everything else looks goid. Ill be back with more....
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Ideal for Texas limestone, hill country.
customer_reviews.text: If you live in the Texas Hill Country (Austin, San Antonio) and have a lot of limestone under a thin layer of dirt, this is the tool you need to dig a post hole or plant a tree. "value for money" is an understatement. This an insane value. If you have to dig even a single hole around here, this will pay for itself in seconds..
customer_reviews.author: Count Aaron

customer_reviews.title: It is what it is
customer_reviews.text: Yes it is what they say it is. Just got this yesterday, Did some Digging in Rock Hard So Cal. Dirt and like butter! love it.. I did get the little Shovel head also and its fine. This Does what it says it will do. I have the $129.00 unit and its just fine for this almost 70 year old to dig holes for Trees or such. I would Say for the Price and just what its done in 1 hour sure beats that Pick and Shovel!
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tool, great bargain, heavy
customer_reviews.text: I don't write many reviews so trust me when I say that this tool is excellent. I am hugely impressed. So far it has excelled at each of the jobs I've thrown at it. Severalt tasks I used to to by hand, now complete in minutes. I have used it to break down a concrete patio, demolish an internal wall, remove tiled flooring, and dig through compressed clay soil. Only word of warning is that it is really heavy. Don't expect a tool that takes the sweat away, it just makes normal jobs way, way easier.
customer_reviews.author: Daf

customer_reviews.title: This jack hammer is a wonderful deal. I have used it to remove 1500 ...
customer_reviews.text: $139. This jack hammer is a wonderful deal. I have used it to remove 1500 sq. feet of tile and glued down wood floor. You can rent something similar but you will end up paying more for the rental than just buying this unit. I thought because of its low price it might last halfway through my job. After 1500 square feet it still works like new. I also purchased two wider bits for removing flooring.
customer_reviews.author: thelma milligan

customer_reviews.title: Don't know if it's good or not
customer_reviews.text: Bought the one with damaged case to save a few dollars. Opened upon arrival, looked great, was thrilled until I tried it! It didn't work at all.
customer_reviews.author: Tristian Hayton

customer_reviews.title: Worked really well
customer_reviews.text: I am a contractor and recently needed a jackhammer while remodeling a bathroom. I first looked at renting a jackhammer but decided to give this product a try instead. I was amazed at how well the jackhammer worked. I completed the job with no problem and now I have a jackhammer for future use. I used it to move the plumbing in a 4 inch slab. It did the job with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I have gotten more than one job out of it.
customer_reviews.text: Had a drive way issue at a relatives house and did not want to rent a unit at basically the same cost. It put in a six hour day and made the job easier (A four rental would have been almost the same cost.). I've since used it on two other small jobs. This is certainly not a professional unit meant for a contractor, but it did what I needed it to do. I wore down one blade and bought another. Who knows, I may get another couple of jobs out of it.
customer_reviews.author: FnS

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: This jack hammer has held up to breaking a 30 foot long trench in cured concrete. We've used it for about 10 working hours so far and no issues at all. At a fraction of the cost of a Bosch tool I worried about the longevity of this tool, but so far so good. Build quality seems to be good. The case is very flimsy, but I bought it for the value of the tool.
customer_reviews.author: scottd

customer_reviews.title: Works good and great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: great product so far for the price. fixing my fence that broke with last years storm. I have to make a two food hole for the poles in coral rock. could not do it without it. I wish I would have found this product sooner. Hope it continues to work the way it has so far. I just got it.
customer_reviews.author: Hubert Huici

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Bought to do some under the house excavation after spending a day squatting while swinging a pick-axe. (Ouch). Tool broke up the hard ground with ease and saved me a lot of time and trouble, Having used a 70lbs jack hammer in my distant youth I really like the 35lbs weight. If you are cutting concrete, rocks or a driveway on a cold day you are going to want something bigger and heavier....
customer_reviews.author: Jim and Kate in Nashville, Tennessee

customer_reviews.title: Great tool, can't believe how well it works
customer_reviews.text: Great tool, can't believe how well it works. good weight, bits worked better than expected. Made job from several hours with sledge, to several minutes. Remember, this is a big tool, can be tight for some spaces. The instructions are junk, just look on youtube if you need help (filling oil, installing bits, changing brushes). Oil, i put in 10w40, and it took about 80 mL more to get 80% up the window. It came with about 20 mL in it.
customer_reviews.author: laynemims

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: Someone I think said that they were 50 and they could use this Buster. Well I can beat that by 20 years and yes it does the job. 8" deep path just demolished. Some wall foundations and a large cistern to come. I don't foresee a problem. Not sure what amazons term 'thickness' applies to but I clicked 5 stars anyway. Maybe at 70 I'm a bit thick using this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Brian M. McCreery

customer_reviews.title: Super tool for the price love it
customer_reviews.text: I have used many demo hammers over the years At 61 I still enjoy doing the hard stuff but the body doesn’t agree This hammer is light enough to manage but heavy enough to get the job done It has done exactly what I needed I’m cutting. 4” slab trenching for. New bathroom So far its been a back saver and efficiently broke up the concrete Works just as good as one costing well over a grand For the money you can’t go wrong Beats the hell out of renting a beat up piece of crap that’s been abused every time it’s rented Buy one you’ll get your moneys worth and always have one when you need it
customer_reviews.author: bob paradise

customer_reviews.title: WORTH THE MONEY
customer_reviews.text: I am amazed by this jackhammer. We installed greenhouse poles in recently excavated rocky soil. Shovels made no dent in the rocky ground and neither did our 3100 gym power washer. Decided we’d have to rent a jackhammer at $80 a day. Bought this instead and I’m glad I did. It took several days of casual work and would have killed my two 30-something sons if we tried to get the 14 poles set in a day or two. I would recommend it without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: C. S. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Great price for a DIY tool
customer_reviews.text: Great price for a DIY tool. Used this to break up and dig out deck posts that were encased in about 30 inches of solid concrete. I spent about 8 hours prior to this tool attempting to break the concrete with a sledge and digging iron, and got nowhere. With this tool I was able to break the concrete and remove BOTH posts in about 2 hours time. This thing was an absolute lifesaver and when factoring in gas and time to drive to rent a unit, was more than worth what I paid. Very satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: A real jack hammer for this price?!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is unbelievable! It breaks up concrete 6” thick like butter, I’ve used better hammers that cost wayyyy more but they are also a lot more heavy and harder on your back. I can use this thing all day and laugh it all the way to the bank! It can’t be beat. Frankly they should raise the price by double or dare I say triple. No joke folks, can’t be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Avery

customer_reviews.title: If you are 79 years old like I am, make sure your wife is handy to help!
customer_reviews.text: This tool took out a section of concrete pool deck in no time. One thing that should be included in the manual is: Pull out on the spindle knob, then turn it in order to lock the tool in the spindle. The part that is unclear is the pull out then rotate. A couple of videos are available online at YouTube and type in the product name. I had no trouble with the machine.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Pays for itself in one use...
customer_reviews.text: Not a big fan of "flea market tools", but stuff like this usually pays for itself in one use, and this did. It's obviously a very cheepy weepy tool with flashy paint and a flashy name, but it blasted right through 4 inch asphalt and concrete, and it paid for itself in one use. I weighs a ton... Hopefully, I get a few more jobs out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Educated Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Bought this jack hammer to dig trenches, my soil ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this jack hammer to dig trenches, my soil is hard clay type. after two days it quit working. it will be going back.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Navarro

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for the price
customer_reviews.text: I am a general contractor, and need a variety of tools. This is an exceptional value item. I need this for frequent light to moderate use, and this breaker is the perfect fit. Light enough to easily transport, but sturdy enough to run as long as necessary. I would say if you need a breaker this is a perfect fit. It is rated for 20 hours a week of use, and I see it living up to that. The only drawback is you need to order bits that fit, as they have a reduced shank at the top, over standard 1 1/8 bits.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Chaves

customer_reviews.title: Works great & with low price!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! This tool works perfectly, is easy to use and has a great [low] price. Came with oil in tool. I easily added a little to top-it-off. Easy to put "tip" in and take out. Quiet running. Includes plastic storage case with wheels. The gloves and eye protection are a bonus. By the way, it's an "attractive" tool. Includes two tips - pointed and two-inch blade. Heavy [when lifting up] for this old man. Will hire a couple of guys to run it for the bamboo removal. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Sam (Portland, OR)

customer_reviews.title: As good as the big expensive ones I've used from the ...
customer_reviews.text: This machine is a lot tougher than I thought it would be. As good as the big expensive ones I've used from the rental places. Heavier than it looks in the pics. If you order one, make sure you get a quart of oil. Shell Rottell #40. It's empty when you get it. Also , the secondary handle is on upside down. That's the only way it fits in the case. You need to turn it so the switch is on the top and the cord is on the is on the bottom. Comes with the tool to change it. Two bolts and its done.
customer_reviews.author: 454Malibu

customer_reviews.title: Stalls a bit
customer_reviews.text: Great hammer. Surely does the job of breaking up solid rock. But it seems to stall if you just leave the trigger on the on position and move the bit to a new spot. I find that I have to reset the trigger switch everytime I move the bit. Other than that, it gets the job done. The case is garbage. The latches don't work well, and with the thin plastic construction it breaks and gives way all too easy. Really cheap accessories that come with it too. Dollar store gloves and goggles.
customer_reviews.author: Toby

customer_reviews.title: Small handle bends easy as it fell over one day
customer_reviews.text: Cant say enough about this. No oil leaks or anything for me yet. Small handle bends easy as it fell over one day, and I don't even care. Laughing all the way to the bank as I use this professionally. Charge the work out all the same rate! Will shamefully buy more in a heartbeat as family comes before buying some name brand crap that's made in the same country anyway.
customer_reviews.author: EEH86

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of power for the price
customer_reviews.text: I demolished a large retaining wall (non reenforced) with this thing and it handled it well. Some oil will trickle down the bit, but as long as you make sure the reservoir is full you will be okay. Also, if it doesn't hammer right away just make sure the bit is on a hard surface. The manual mentions this as a safety feature, but it will periodically require a jostle to get it hammering again.
customer_reviews.author: Alex S

customer_reviews.title: works well for hardpan
customer_reviews.text: I live in an area where I have about 12" of hardpan about 12" down so it was a difficult and back breaking task to dig a hole to plant a tree. This thing works great, breaks up the hardpan easily and quickly. Still not easy to plant a tree but the time and effort is greatly reduced. For the money it is well worth it. The case is cheap and easily cracks but the tool is good.
customer_reviews.author: M Grima

customer_reviews.title: You can own a jackhammer for only a little more than it is to rent one
customer_reviews.text: Needed to demo a 6x8 concrete pad, cost to rent a jackhammer was $75 a day, versus buying this one. It worked great at busting up the concrete, some of it 8 inches thick. The bits are decent, the gloves and the goggles you can toss out. Uses motor oil for its oil fill. It honestly works better than some of the very expensive units I've rented. Well worth it for the money. Plan to use it to replace some broken up sidewalk soon.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Peeler

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, but reliable!
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this thing went above and beyond! Yes, after tearing out a few tons of concrete it did leak oil, and yes the bit has begun to wear down. But for what I paid, it got the job done! Definitely a disposable tool, but I've been lending to neighbors and friends and they are getting it to do what they need also! I strongly recommend this thing. It won't cut through a 10" slab, but for light duty stuff up to about 6" it has no issues whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Megan S.

customer_reviews.title: Great Home Jack Hammer
customer_reviews.text: For a little more than the price of a 1 day rental, you can buy this Jack hammer and it will work as designed. I used mine to break up concrete steps that were solidly built (I tried for days by hand to chisel the steps with little breakage). This jack hammer is easy to use and broke up the steps in less than 30 minutes - amazing. As other reviewers have said - this is a great jack hammer for the price and it works well with a standard extension cord...
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Back to 5 stars~
customer_reviews.text: So, I originally gave this 5 stars. Then on the 6th use, it quit working. I sent two emails to the seller, without a word in reply. So, I downgraded to 1 star. I needed a jackhammer to finish a job, so I opened the trigger case, found a loose contact, and I was back in business. I would remove 1 star for having to service it myself so soon, but I used it for 7 hours straight yesterday, and 4 more today without issue, and it saved my ass... So, back to 5...
customer_reviews.author: The Taylor Family

customer_reviews.title: Yowza lots of power.
customer_reviews.text: This review is for XtremepowerUS 2200Watt Heavy Duty Electric Demolition Jack hammer. Wow it has plenty of power, and runs great from a 3500W generator. An amusing story: We stuck a screwdriver blade between the jackhammer chisel and the target (don't ask why.) The shock waves were so intense the plastic screwdriver handle exploded.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Dense packed sand under the concrete was easily broken up with the accessory shovel
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a beast! Just tore up 5O feet of 4 inch thick concrete in my garage for sewer line replacement. Couldn't have done it without this tool. No parts became loose and only used a little oil. After initial fill up of oil I'm still at over half full. Dense packed sand under the concrete was easily broken up with the accessory shovel. So hard I couldn't dig with a regular shovel and had to use a pick axe until I tried the demo shovel. It's heavy and you have to bend over to use it so it can wear you out! Back pain!
customer_reviews.author: Schwendy

customer_reviews.title: Just ok for small project
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. This will work for light/med work. The seals seem poor. Oil leaks from bottom seal. It will break soft limestone rocks (what I need) but I doubt it will last long. This seems to be an imported product from China with little support. I could not even find a manual or recommended oil on the USA web site. If you only need a jack hammer for a small job, this may be easier than renting a better one. I suspect that when it dies, it will not be repairable. Kind of a shame to have a "disposable" tool like this. Just more trash in the long run.
customer_reviews.author: R Martin Customer Service

customer_reviews.title: Lubricating oil seal starting to leak after one hour of use. Good hammer for the price.
customer_reviews.text: It does a pretty good job-especially for the price. I’ve used pneumatic demolition hammers before...this would keep up with those in the short run. I’ve used this one for approximately one hour breaking apart 4” sidewalk cement. Starting to leak oil from the seal. No big deal until/unless the seal fails completely. Have reasonable expectations and this hammer may be just want you need for an affordable price.
customer_reviews.author: Red Cloud

product_meta.title: XtremepowerUS 2200Watt Heavy Duty Electric Demolition Jack hammer Concrete Breaker W/Case, Gloves
product_meta.description:
Size:2200Watt

This 2200 Watt electric jack hammer delivers 1800 impacts per minute at 55 ft/lbs which can break up the hardest of surfaces. Since an air compressor is not required, this is one of the most portable jack hammers in the market. Adjustable 360° foregrip provides extra control and comfort during extended use. Our jack hammer is perfect for breaking up concrete, asphalt, mortar, hard clay, rocks, bricks and more! This jack hammer is perfect for home renovations or stone masonry project.

Features:

 * It is perfect for demolition, trenching, chipping, breaking holes in concrete, block, brick, tile stucco, housing foundation removal, concrete slab, oil chimney and much more!
 * Adjustable 360 degree foregrip provides extra control that makes it easy to conveniently adjust based on the positioning you need for the job at hand
 * Available for Home and Commercial with the voltage of 110v/60 HZ, it's suitable for you to use it at home and business
 * Excellent heavy-duty drilling power makes your work more efficient, use it at ease
 * It accepts 1-1/8 in. hex shank bits
 * Delivers 1800 BPM for fast demolition
 * Including Electric Demolition Jack Hammer with 16" bull point chisel, 16" flat chisel, pair of protective gloves, protective goggles, hex wrenches and carrying case

Specifications:

 * Color: Red
 * Power Type: Electric
 * Voltage: 110V/60Hz
 * Motor Power: 2200 Watts
 * Chuck Size: 1-1/8 In.
 * Chuck Type: Hex
 * No Load Speed: 1900RPM
 * Speed: 1800 Impacts Per Minute

Package Contents:

 * 2200 Watt Electric Demolition Jack Hammer
 * 16" Bull Point Chisel
 * 16" Flat Chisel
 * Protective Gloves
 * Protective Goggles
 * Oil Bottle
 * 3 x Hex Keys
 * Wrench
 * Carrying Case with Handle
feature_bullets: It is perfect for demolition, trenching, chipping, breaking holes in concrete, block, brick, tile stucco, housing foundation removal, concrete slab, oil chimney and much more!
Adjustable 360 degree foregrip provides extra control that makes it easy to conveniently adjust based on the positioning you need for the job at hand
Available for Home and Commercial with the voltage of 110v/60 HZ, it's suitable for you to use it at home and business
It accepts 1-1/8 in. hex shank bits; Delivers 1800 BPM for fast demolition
Including Electric Demolition Jack Hammer with 16" bull point chisel, 16" flat chisel, pair of protective gloves, protective goggles, hex wrenches

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars2,179 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
